summary.p: After the agreement with some politicians in Zurich [about the printing of his chronicle], he learned that Aegidius Tschudi also intends to publish a chronicle; he asks Bullinger to influence [Diethelm] Röist and [Hans Rudolf] Lavater in favor of his work and to respond to him through Peter Wick.

div.p: Dear sir and brother, according to our agreement (regarding the chronicle with Mr. Röist, treasurer of Küsnacht, Haben, Lavater, and other Zurichers favorable to the matter), I am informed that... Dear sir and brother, according to our agreement (regarding the chronicles with Mr. Röist, treasurers of Küsnacht, Haben, Lavater, and others favorable to the matter), I am informed that...
Therefore, I wish to solicit this without delay... Therefore, I wish to solicit this more promptly... Yours, Johannes Stumpf.
To the pious, well-learned, and faithful master Heinrich Bullinger, preacher of the gospel in Zurich, my dear sir and brother.
